SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.mime

Class EmailParser

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.mime.EmailParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class EmailParser extends Object implements AutoCloseable
EmailParser is a standalone MIME email parser that extracts email headers, body content, and attachments from RFC 2822 formatted email messages.

This parser handles:

  • Multi-line headers with proper folding support
  • Single and multipart MIME messages
  • Various content encodings (Base64, Quoted-Printable, plain text)
  • Nested multipart structures and embedded messages (message/rfc822)
  • Attachment detection and classification by MIME type
  • Content hashing (SHA-1, SHA-256, MD5) for integrity verification

The parser is designed as a reusable library for any Java application needing to parse email messages programmatically. It can be integrated into MTA implementations, email processing pipelines, forensic tools, or testing frameworks.

This class implements AutoCloseable to ensure proper cleanup of temporary files created for non-text MIME parts. The close() method deletes temporary part files but not the main email file.

Example usage: 

 try (EmailParser parser = new EmailParser("/path/to/email.eml")) {
     parser.parse();
     MimeHeaders headers = parser.getHeaders();
     List<MimePart> parts = parser.getParts();
 }
See Also:
  • MimeHeaders

  • Field Details

    • log

      private static final org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger log

    • stream

      private final LineInputStream stream
      Email input stream with line-based reading and pushback buffer support. Maintains position for boundary detection and part parsing.

    • headers

      private final MimeHeaders headers
      Container for all email headers parsed from the message header section. Supports multi-line headers and parameter extraction.

    • parts

      private final List<MimePart> parts
      List of parsed MIME parts extracted from the email body. Includes both inline content and attachments, maintaining structure and metadata.

  • Constructor Details

    • EmailParser

      public EmailParser(String path) throws FileNotFoundException
      Constructs a new EmailParser instance from a file path.

      Uses a default pushback buffer size of 1024 bytes, which is sufficient for most email messages. The pushback buffer is used for boundary detection and backtracking when reading multipart boundaries.

      Parameters:
      path - Path to the email file (.eml format)
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the email file does not exist or cannot be opened
      See Also:
      • EmailParser(String, int)

    • EmailParser

      public EmailParser(String path, int size) throws FileNotFoundException
      Constructs a new EmailParser instance from a file path with custom buffer size.

      Allows customization of the pushback buffer size. Use a larger buffer if parsing very complex multipart messages with large boundaries, or a smaller buffer for memory-constrained environments.

      Parameters:
      path - Path to the email file (.eml format)
      size - Pushback buffer size in bytes. Recommended minimum: 512, default: 1024
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the email file does not exist or cannot be opened
      See Also:
      • EmailParser(LineInputStream)

    • EmailParser

      public EmailParser(LineInputStream stream)
      Constructs a new EmailParser instance from an existing LineInputStream.

      Use this constructor for advanced scenarios such as parsing email content from network streams, memory buffers, or other custom input sources. The parser does not take ownership of the stream and will close it after parsing completes.

      Parameters:
      stream - A pre-configured LineInputStream for reading email content
      See Also:
      • LineInputStream

  • Method Details

    • getHeaders

      public MimeHeaders getHeaders()
      Gets the parsed email headers.

      The returned MimeHeaders object contains all headers from the email message, including standard headers (From, To, Subject, Date, etc.) and custom headers. Multi-line headers are properly unfolded and available for parameter extraction.

      Returns:
      MimeHeaders instance containing all parsed headers
      See Also:
      • MimeHeaders

    • getParts

      public List<MimePart> getParts()
      Gets the parsed MIME parts from the email body.

      Returns a list of all MIME parts extracted from the email, including:

      • Text parts (plain text, HTML)
      • Attachments and embedded files
      • Related parts (inline images, stylesheets)
      • Nested multipart structures
      Each part includes metadata such as content type, encoding, size, and content hashes.
      Returns:
      Unmodifiable list of MimePart objects
      See Also:
      • MimePart

    • parse

      public EmailParser parse() throws IOException
      Parses the complete email message including headers and body.

      This is a convenience method equivalent to calling parse(false). After parsing completes, the underlying stream is automatically closed. Use this method for standard email parsing workflows.

      Returns:
      Self for method chaining
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while reading the email file
      See Also:
      • parse(boolean)

    • parse

      public EmailParser parse(boolean headersOnly) throws IOException
      Parses the email with optional header-only mode.

      Set headersOnly to true to parse only the email headers without reading the body. This is useful for quick header extraction or when full message parsing is not needed. The underlying stream is automatically closed after parsing.

      Parsing is a single-pass operation. After calling this method, the parser's state is finalized and cannot be reset.

      Parameters:
      headersOnly - If true, only headers are parsed; if false, headers and body are parsed
      Returns:
      Self for method chaining
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while reading the email file

    • parseHeaders

      private void parseHeaders() throws IOException
      Parses email headers from the input stream.

      Reads and processes all headers up to the blank line that separates headers from body. Properly handles RFC 2822 header folding (multi-line headers). The method stores parsed headers in the headers collection using MimeHeader objects that support parameter extraction and value manipulation.

      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while reading from the stream

    • parseBody

      private void parseBody() throws IOException
      Parses email body to extract MIME parts.

      Analyzes the Content-Type header to determine if the message is multipart. For multipart messages, extracts the boundary parameter and recursively parses each part. For single-part messages, reads the body content and processes encoding. Supports nested multipart structures and embedded messages (message/rfc822).

      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while reading from the stream

    • getFileName

      private String getFileName(MimeHeaders headers)
      Determines the filename for a MIME part based on headers.

      Attempts to extract filename from Content-Disposition header first, then falls back to Content-Type header. If no explicit filename is present, generates a filename based on MIME type and part index. This ensures all parts can be uniquely identified and extracted to the filesystem.

      Parameters:
      headers - MimeHeaders instance containing part headers
      Returns:
      Filename string, or empty string if unable to determine

    • parsePart

      private void parsePart(String boundary) throws IOException
      Parses individual MIME parts within a multipart message.

      Reads and processes parts separated by the specified boundary string. Handles nested multipart structures, embedded RFC 822 messages, and various content encodings. Each part's headers are parsed and content is decoded according to Content-Transfer-Encoding specification. Supports recursion for deeply nested multipart structures.

      Parameters:
      boundary - MIME boundary string that separates parts
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while reading from the stream

    • parsePartContent

      private MimePart parsePartContent(boolean isTextPart, MimeHeaders headers, String boundary) throws IOException
      Parses and decodes MIME part content with integrity verification.

      Reads the raw content of a MIME part up to the boundary marker (if present). Automatically detects and applies content transfer encoding:

      • Base64: Decodes from Base64 to binary
      • Quoted-Printable: Decodes from Quoted-Printable to binary
      • 7bit/8bit/binary: Reads as-is without transformation
      For each part, calculates cryptographic hashes (SHA-1, SHA-256, MD5) on the decoded content for integrity verification and forensic purposes.
      Parameters:
      isTextPart - Boolean indicating if this is a text/* MIME type (affects part creation)
      headers - MimeHeaders instance containing Content-Transfer-Encoding and other metadata
      boundary - Optional MIME boundary string to detect part end (null for non-multipart)
      Returns:
      Fully parsed MimePart with decoded content and hash values set
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs reading from the stream or during decoding

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the EmailParser and cleans up temporary files created for MIME parts.

      This method deletes temporary files associated with FileMimePart instances that were created during parsing. The main email file is not deleted.

      This method is called automatically when using try-with-resources.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
